column1: But we can all play a role to help out this holiday season: I encourage you to visit your favorite shops whether online or safely in person and #ShopSmall. Reply with your favorite small businesses that you plan to support this year! #SmallBizSat

Today is #SmallBizSat & while holiday shopping is very different this year our commitment to support our small businesses has never been more important. I’ll keep fighting to deliver the federal relief our small businesses need to keep their doors open & staff on payroll. https://t.co/q201iZpqP0

Our military families make tremendous sacrifices for our country from spouses who pick up & re-establish the family w/each station change to kids who go months or more without moms or dads who are serving overseas to keep us all safe & free. Thank you. #MilitaryFamilyMonth https://t.co/kSs5WpBhPe

Thinking back to this holiday season a few years ago. While our celebrations look different this year the sentiment is the same: showing thanks for the people in our lives giving back to those less fortunate & hoping for a brighter year ahead. Wishing you a happy Thanksgiving. https://t.co/ZOqCZqiYEu

International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women is a reminder about the necessity of creating policies that protect and empower women and girls in every corner of the world. I have and will continue to fight for reforms that do just that. https://t.co/heYe8yzlpV

COVID cases are surging in NH & across the nation. NH families communities health care providers & more need help & are relying on Congress to act. The NH delegation and I are here ready to work – Republicans need to come back to the negotiating table so we can get this done. https://t.co/7BXdbXsLor

NH communities need to have the federal resources necessary to execute a comprehensive vaccine distribution strategy – from communications to education materials to infrastructure. Congress needs to act now so we are ready as soon as vaccines are available. https://t.co/YjseGQLaZ3

This has long been a concern & why I wrote legislation to hold e-cig companies targeting minors accountable. We know the health risks tied to vaping. Congress can & should act on this issue. @senatemajldr can start by giving my bill a vote. https://t.co/P7mk1ddBIZ

The Biden admin nominations give me great confidence in how Joe Biden will hit the ground running on Day 1. We need an admin that will steer our nation through the challenges we face at home & abroad. I have full faith President-elect Biden is building a team to do just that. https://t.co/6FkT6gX0OH

It’s almost time! Excited to cheer on Jon from Manchester’s Bearded Baking Company tonight on @FoodNetwork’s Holiday Baking Championship. Can’t wait to see what sweet treats are in store - I’m sure you’ll do NH proud. https://t.co/SxErd6HoaF

Thank you @CBSThisMorning for shining a light on my effort w/@RoyBlunt to fix this problem. Cost should never be a barrier to care & that’s particularly critical w/breast cancer diagnostic tests which can save lives. It’s past time our bipartisan bill got a vote. https://t.co/03CISK2wwq

No one better for the job – congrats @JohnKerry. Reasserting U.S. global leadership in the fight against climate change is one of the most important tasks ahead. Ready to work w/ you to build a cleaner safer and more sustainable future for our country & world. https://t.co/y15ciol9St

Great to see a Granite Stater take on this immense responsibility in the Biden admin to lead our nat'l security priorities. Congrats Jake Sullivan. Looking forward to working w/the new admin to advance U.S. foreign policy that keeps our nation safe & preserves global stability. https://t.co/iib3IhWXzI

Did you know $2.8 billion of NH’s GDP is outdoor rec which supported +37k jobs in our state in 2019? This is why I wrote the law requiring the gov’t to measure the economic impact of outdoor rec -- collecting this data can help guide important policy decisions.

Preserving our parks & lands means ensuring these outdoor spaces are here for generations of Granite Staters to explore & enjoy. It’s also about investing in a key sector of our economy: outdoor recreation. https://t.co/AW7gJmtUkf

.@NHNationalGuard is on the frontlines of this crisis & will play an important role in distributing a future vaccine. The President needs to extend authorization & FULL funding to ensure they can continue to assist w/ NH’s response efforts especially w/ the surge of cases. https://t.co/Ineojrymhq

The votes have been counted – Joe Biden won. @USGSA’s refusal to ascertain the results of the election undermines a peaceful transition of power – the bedrock of our democracy. It also risks our COVID response including vaccine distribution. We can't let that happen. https://t.co/RGDul1Rdqg

The conflict in Tigray is dire – there needs to be an immediate de-escalation of violence. Authorities must restore peace & communication in the region to allow for humanitarian relief. The refugee crisis in Ethiopia is alarming – aid orgs must have access to assist civilians. https://t.co/W0eSMqUV0y

Today I joined the NH delegation in a call w/@NHHospitals. In NH COVID-19 cases are surging & hospitalizations are increasing. Our hospitals on the frontlines need help now to stay open. Republicans need to come to the negotiating table so we can get federal relief out the door.

Financial strain caused by #COVID19 has left our seniors even more susceptible to scams. Glad to share that legislation I cosponsored that would help them identify these scams & increase efforts to monitor & respond to fraud is moving forward in Congress. https://t.co/GGHYMZi420

Lead poisoning is a serious issue that’s persisted in NH for far too long. By helping to cover lead removal costs my bill w/@SenWhitehouse & @SenatorHassan would be a key step towards helping families eliminate this hazard from their homes once & for all. https://t.co/ZOJqMqQXaX

The violence against our trans community is horrific. Too many lives have been taken. We remember their names & honor their lives w/ action. Together we must keep fighting for rights & protections for trans Americans & stamp out hate everywhere it exists. #TransDayOfRemembrance https://t.co/dUx5sNiksx

Today’s delivery of PPE for VA facilities will provide health care workers on the frontlines in NH & around the country the protection they need to safely care for our veterans during this crisis. Thank you Dean Kamen & all those involved in making this delivery a reality. https://t.co/IOBS6tEJg6

Anytime an American is unlawfully imprisoned the U.S. must do everything in its power to secure their freedom. This new data from the @JamesFoleyFund underscores the urgent need to keep up that fight. Thank you Diane & all those working to bring Americans home. https://t.co/JjEc3aqdvF

Drought conditions are having a serious impact on our farms which are staples in our communities & play an important role in NH’s economy. If you’re a farmer in need of assistance there’s help available: visit https://t.co/hxrxyqeJc2 to learn about available disaster assistance https://t.co/mAVsxFVadC

#COVID19 has had a severe and disproportionate impact on nursing homes & long-term care facilities in NH. The admin needs to implement the CARES Act as Congress intended & distribute funding in a way that matches the scope of this crisis in our communities. https://t.co/Ss5Nx7SlXx

¼ million Americans have died. More are falling ill & dying every day. Granite Staters & all Americans impacted by this crisis don’t care about party or politics they care about putting food on the table paying their bills & staying healthy. It is past time to get a deal done.

I know Granite Staters will heed the mask mandate & other measures to protect each other like maintaining social distance & avoiding gatherings. But it’s overdue for @senatemajldr to let Congress do its job & come together to fight the virus instead of blocking negotiations.

These numbers are distressing & sadly will worsen if we don’t all do our part. As public health officials have long warned us: masks are the best way to slow the spread of COVID. We should always be following science & the facts. https://t.co/3twydIIejB

Congrats Deputy Chief McQuillen! Great news for Portsmouth FD & our community w/ you joining Department leadership. Thank you for your continued service that keeps NH families safe.🚒 https://t.co/21HMxaiTG0

These aren’t just numbers – these are lives. These are parents children friends coworkers and more. Please wear a mask. Please practice social distancing. Let’s take care of each other and get to the other side of this crisis. https://t.co/xcMkne1yGI

With so many in need of housing food & financial assistance the urgency for COVID relief is dire. Families small biz health care providers & all those struggling are relying on Congress to act. The partisanship has to end. We did it before let’s do it again & get a deal done. https://t.co/9QQN20xjiY

Pleased to announce $257K to strengthen natural coastal infrastructure on the Seacoast which will help protect communities & precious habitat from rising sea levels. I'll keep fighting for funds to protect NH from the effects of climate change. https://t.co/sZfz0ewG8v

Educators are dealing with significant challenges due to #COVID19 and continue to be a source of knowledge strength & support for their students during these tough times. Thank you to all of the teachers & staff for being heroes in & out of the classroom. #AmericanEducationWeek https://t.co/2cPOwo715h

82% of COVID-related deaths in NH have occurred among nursing home residents – the highest rate in the U.S. Yet @HHSgov’s formula for distributing funds isn’t providing NH facilities the support they need to match the scope of the crisis in these facilities. This must change NOW. https://t.co/6bAXJ9Uhmw

I'll work w/anyone of any party if it means delivering for NH. As we confront COVID & other serious issues bipartisanship has never been as critical. Thank you @TheKeystoneCtr for this kind recognition & discussion on coming together to tackle the challenges facing our nation. https://t.co/hKwquOAaMI
I urge the administration to follow these laws & not cause irreparable harm to U.S. national security our alliances or the people of these nations.

We can’t allow these countries to yet again become a safe haven for terrorists who want to harm Americans. Any withdrawal must be conditions-based. Congress passed existing laws to ensure any future withdrawal is not based on arbitrary timelines or political considerations. https://t.co/TGalAW9NYt

Remember: open enrollment season to sign up for health care has started! Nearly 6 million Americans have lost health coverage b/c of COVID-19. Now more than ever it's important to make sure that every family has access to the care they need. #GetCovered at https://t.co/jZzBcoEXgY

Glad to join NH postal workers to thank them for their service on the frontlines of #COVID19 and work during the election that ensured every ballot was counted. I stand by the USPS and will keep fighting for federal relief to protect the agency’s vital service to all Americans. https://t.co/4dv3IqRwuh
Read more here: https://t.co/kgIYUg4eg7

My bipartisan bill w/@SenatorCollins @RepRaulRuizMD to ensure that vets w/ service-related disabilities forever have free access to national parks and federal lands just cleared the House & is headed to the President's desk. I urge the President to sign this bill into law ASAP.

500 Granite Staters have been taken from us each one of them a beloved family member friend or colleague. My thoughts are with the loved ones mourning & with those who are fighting to recover from this virus. The foot-dragging in Washington to respond to this crisis has to end. https://t.co/to1RNKQdPG

So proud of my granddaughter Elle for sharing her story about living w/ type 1 diabetes. Lowering the cost of insulin investing in research & finding a cure must be bipartisan priorities for the 34.2 million Americans like Elle living w/ diabetes. https://t.co/Uutpwhb53P

November is Native American Heritage Month. This is an opportunity to recognize & celebrate the culture traditions & contributions of Native Americans & reaffirm our commitment to fight for fair representation of all indigenous people. https://t.co/lSOZSHsQuy

In our discussion on Friday restaurant owners & industry leaders made it clear they need help NOW to survive the winter & keep their doors open. Bipartisan negotiations in Congress must resume ASAP to deliver the relief communities need to get to the other side of this crisis. https://t.co/nhDUDnsA0r

To infinity and beyond! Congrats @SpaceX Crew-1 mission on a successful launch from @NASAKennedy. Another remarkable milestone for science and U.S. space exploration. 🚀#LaunchAmerica https://t.co/ECOSrJZ0fC

Today is #WorldDiabetesDay. 34.2 million Americans - over 1 in 10 - live w/diabetes. For far too many the skyrocketing cost of insulin is a matter of life or death. Today & every day I’m fighting to lower the cost of insulin & prescription drugs & support efforts to find a cure.
Wishing happiness prosperity and joy to all those in New Hampshire and across the world celebrating the Festival of Lights. Happy #Diwali!

➡️3% pay increase for our service members ➡️Funding to implement my bipartisan bill that was signed into law to cut red tape for military spouses ➡️$160M for critical projects at PNSY & funding for 15 additional KC-46 aerial refueling tankers  Read more: https://t.co/K7kY4i4rVz
The Senate government funding bill includes a number of critical NH & national security priorities that I fought for including:

.@StateDept – despite efforts to downplay the impact – has admitted the admin’s expansion of the Global Gag Rule is hurting access to health services. Yet they’re moving ahead w/another unprecedented expansion – & during a pandemic. This has to stop. https://t.co/OY2iciSdth

👇That's because of dedicated gov't workers & w/ investments from Congress that prioritized election security efforts after the 2016 attacks. Questioning the 2020 results isn’t just wrong: it’s a political attack to undermine faith in our democracy. We shouldn’t stand for it. https://t.co/DsvwAH2HrA

My sincerest condolences to the Johnson family as they mourn the loss of their husband and father Rogers. I join Granite Staters in remembering his work on behalf of Seacoast families and the African American community.

Today I spoke w/ @NHLRA about #COVID19's impact on NH’s hospitality sector. Thanks to PPP many NH restaurants & hotels have been able to weather this crisis. But additional relief is needed NOW to help them get to the other side of this pandemic. There is no time to waste.

This report is concerning and underscores the importance of the refugee resettlement program. The U.S. must keep its promise to Iraqi translators & civilians who've stood beside U.S. forces on the battlefield risking their lives & families’ safety to advance the U.S. mission. https://t.co/j0KkdqioIZ

I’ll work across the aisle to get these NH priorities over the finish line & will keep up the fight to add comprehensive COVID-19 relief to this bill. Our communities on the frontlines can’t wait – they need help now.
✅$285M for the High Intensity Drug Trafficking Area Program.  ✅ $101.5M for the Drug Free Communities Program to prevent youth substance use.

✅$50M for the construction of @DEAHQ's first drug lab in the region - a significant boost in NH's efforts to trace & combat fentanyl trafficking. ✅$539M for Department of Justice grant programs to combat substance use.

Addressing the substance use epidemic in the Granite State has never been more important.  That's why I fought to include provisions to help turn the tide on this epidemic in newly unveiled government funding legislation including:

These numbers are alarming. This pandemic isn’t over & neither should @senatemajldr’s willingness to allow bipartisan negotiations on #COVID19 relief. Our communities need help now to match the full scope of this crisis. We’ve lost too many lives & many more are still at risk. https://t.co/rqpIH0Jh4E

Each year Laura Landerman-Garber’s Holiday Cards 4 Our Military Challenge delivers warm wishes from NH & Americans across the nation to our troops serving overseas. It was wonderful to take part & I thank Laura for her work to lift the spirits of our heroes during the holidays. https://t.co/08EKqk8Zfi

Reminder! Open enrollment for health care coverage is underway through December 15. Visit https://t.co/upkeVVxRJL to shop around check your eligibility for tax credits & financial assistance & #GetCovered.

My deepest condolences to the families of the 6 U.S. service members & their fellow peacekeepers killed in this devastating crash. Peacekeepers face tremendous uncertainty & danger in pursuit of the noblest of causes. They are patriots. Their service is one we must never forget. https://t.co/2KU326oMzj

Grateful to be in Boscawen to honor our veterans their families & military around the globe on this #VeteransDay. It's our duty & promise to our veterans to never forget their service nor lose sight of the freedoms they fought to secure. Today – and every day – we thank you. https://t.co/Z8AZfYWVxl

As Dems & Rs come together from both chambers to finalize this bill it MUST provide assistance to match the full scope of the COVID-19 health & economic emergencies. We are still in the middle of this pandemic & Americans need help now to survive & recover from this crisis.

NEW! The Senate FY21 gov’t funding bill is out & contains numerous NH priorities: a pay raise for service members resources for first responders robust funding to turn the tide on the substance use disorder epidemic & more. But our work is far from over. https://t.co/QE0mokkvTj

Today is National Economic Impact Payment Day. Through November 21st eligible non-filers can register online to receive an Economic Impact Payment. Find out your eligibility today ➡️ https://t.co/CnerZnnV2T

Proud of NH employers who made efforts to prioritize hiring veterans into their organizations. The skill work ethic & dedication of military members & veterans is unmatched. Thank you for recognizing the value in hiring retaining & supporting veterans. https://t.co/SBeVWOoM9i
Our communities were devastated by their actions & shouldn’t be part of their marketing scheme to rebuild their image. https://t.co/H6mJTTMfrs

It’s egregious that @theJusticeDept struck a deal to allow Purdue Pharma – which was culpable in exacerbating the opioid crisis – to become a public benefit corporation. NH has been one of the hardest-hit states in the nation by the substance use disorder epidemic.

The hospitalization rate for COVID patients continues to soar across the country and is the highest it’s been since July. Access to affordable care & the pre-existing conditions protections that the ACA provides is critical for Granite Staters & American families everywhere. https://t.co/3PMKVV1OEe

...critical protections including 100K+ Granite Staters who could lose coverage amid COVID & we'd lose our best tool to fight the opioid epidemic: Medicaid expansion. ACA must remain the law of the land. Americans' health care is at risk & protecting it is more vital than ever.

The GOP failed to overturn the Affordable Care Act dozens of times in Congress. Now they’re trying in the courts. Today the Supreme Court heard oral arguments in a case to strike down the health care law. If the ACA is struck down millions w/pre-existing conditions would lose...

Happy birthday Marines! Wishing a very happy 245th birthday to the generations of @USMC men & women who’ve served w/ courage honor & valor. Thank you to all who have served and for your service to America and its people. #HappyBirthdayMarines https://t.co/p5qmp7aioP

Students should always feel safe in school. Thank you @sandyhook for this humbling recognition. Too many Americans have been lost to or suffer from gun violence – together we must enact meaningful policies to keep our schools streets and communities safe. https://t.co/P6PZ3yJlI6
Marty was beloved by @MWObs visitors and Granite Staters alike. Sad to lose our little steward of Mt. Washington. https://t.co/zzgeDm8jyN

Now more than ever it's important to have access to a health care plan that can help your family stay healthy. Visit https://t.co/upkeVVxRJL to shop around check your eligibility for tax credits & financial assistance & #GetCovered. Spread the word.

Glad @USDA is providing a new food distributor to @NHFB following my call w/the NH delegation for an investigation into the low-quality product provided by the previous supplier. Now more than ever vulnerable NH families need access to high-quality nutritious food supplies. https://t.co/XhI5okR6H3

More than 10 million Americans have been diagnosed with #COVID19 & we’re seeing record-high surges across the country including spikes in NH. Congress needs to act now. We wrote the CARES Act together & I believe we can do it again. We can - we MUST - get this done. https://t.co/8RhvmYEvFa

The President’s decision to abruptly fire his Defense Secretary while simultaneously denying the outcome of our democratic elections is deeply concerning and creates dangerous uncertainty. It’s time to end the chaos and unite our country so we can move forward together. https://t.co/J2CnAqDiGq

#COVID19 has exacerbated the substance use disorder crisis. Now more than ever NH youth drug prevention coalitions need resources to help prevent future generations from succumbing to this epidemic. This funding is a critical investment in that effort. https://t.co/8UeVpGMRBL

NH small biz need access to capital to weather COVID-19. Glad to announce a $600K @USDA investment in the Wentworth Economic Development Corporation to establish a loan fund for Lakes Region small biz – helping them to retain & create jobs & stay afloat. https://t.co/WBz4bTZG7D

On #STEMDay we recognize the importance of helping young people in their pursuit of STEM fields. Increasing resources for STEM education drives innovation & prosperity. As a senior member of the Senate Appropriations Committee I’ll keep fighting for efforts to prioritize STEM.

Glad @HHSGov heeded my call & will release $25M for NH through the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program. LIHEAP provides critical heating assistance to more than 28K Granite Staters during the coldest months of the year & is needed now more than ever. https://t.co/ArDLqJbgBj

Pleased to announce $467K in NBRC & @USDA funding that will empower rural NH communities by expanding access to workforce training for NH's outdoor rec economy & providing forest economy businesses with the support they need to weather COVID-19. Read more: https://t.co/bwluOn7P4A

POTUS-elect Biden & VP-elect Harris' win isn’t just a victory for all Americans; it’s transformational for women especially women of color. My heart is w/ women & girls who for the 1st time will see themselves in 1 of the highest offices in the land. This is your story too.
Congrats President-elect! Looking forward to working with you & VP-elect/Senate President @SenKamalaHarris. 😎 https://t.co/FP64TAZhPA
That's why I was thrilled when staff at @Londonderry_mte invited me to highlight their virtual book fair! Join me as I read Shel Silverstein's Where The Sidewalk Ends. https://t.co/ab0Ep4BY5P

During such a difficult and stressful time for NH children reading has never been more important. It is such a powerful tool allowing kids to be transported to new faraway lands create friendships with new characters feel hope and alleviate uncertainty and doubt.

.@NOAA MUST uphold its Scientific Integrity Policy especially as the Trump administration installs new political appointees including a climate change denier that seek to politicize & stifle NOAA’s scientific research. Science & facts must always triumph over politics. https://t.co/akk4jePxoE

The health insurance open enrollment period begins TODAY! Despite the admin's sabotage efforts the ACA continues to provide Americans access to affordable coverage. Many qualify for tax credits to help pay premiums. Find a plan that works for you & spread the word. #GetCovered https://t.co/RRB1lF8U1b

I’m glad Congress got this done and that it is now the law of the land. This is an important step forward but our work to enact protections and seek justice for all survivors goes on.  https://t.co/qV76c5uYWd

This historic legislation is a testament to the brave survivors who stepped forward to enact change at the highest level. Because of their tireless work this bill will help ensure the U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee protects athletes today the way it should have all along.

Now more than ever NH families in need deserve nutritional food supplies. @USDA needs to investigate the low-quality food provided by a new distributor to NH children & families. This is unacceptable especially in the midst of a global health crisis. https://t.co/uYaTEBCA3S

Tomorrow marks 20 yrs since @UN Sec. Res. 1325 was adopted reaffirming women’s role in peacebuilding & conflict resolution. @SenatorBaldwin & I are pushing @POTUS to honor that promise by standing w/Afghan women & prioritizing their inclusion in their nation's peace talks. https://t.co/tuAUgB8Upa

Another reason why the Trump admin should drop its ACA lawsuit: If SCOTUS strikes down the ACA it could eliminate requirement for insurers to cover a COVID-19 vaccine w/o copays&deductibles. A vaccine is vital to getting life back to normal & should require no out-of-pocket costs

I was pleased to join @CleanEnergyNH’s virtual conference today. I'm proud to be a champion for clean energy & energy efficiency. Both create urgently needed jobs while reducing energy costs for NH homeowners & businesses. Investing in a clean energy future is a win-win.

Thank you @NHBR for hosting this discussion about “Operation HR” an initiative to promote hiring veterans in businesses across NH. I’m forever grateful for our veterans & proud to support efforts like this that will ease their transition from military to civilian life. https://t.co/zvUjBgMPzZ

Many child care facilities in NH are at risk of closing their doors due to the financial impact of #COVID19. They are crucial to NH’s economic recovery & working families. This morning I heard about challenges Seacoast providers are still facing. Bipartisan help is needed ASAP! https://t.co/fpetbBiEAw

It’s just plain wrong when Pres. Trump makes this about blue states & red states. All across the country municipalities are struggling to keep firefighters police teachers & librarians on the job. NH is no exception. Let’s get a bill done that provides help! https://t.co/e7XiSl3Aae

Very glad Shkliarov was finally released after being unlawfully arrested & detained like so many in Belarus. Appreciate State Dept.’s response to my calls & others to bring him home. Anytime an American is held against their will we must do all we can to secure their freedom. https://t.co/ZFSdf0MVYE

This morning I met w/ tourism industry leaders at the @whitemts Visitor Center - our tourism industry needs COVID relief ASAP & a 2nd round of PPP to survive #COVID19. Tourism is NH’s 2nd largest industry – supporting tens of thousands of jobs local communities & NH's economy. https://t.co/8PX4Qj0NRw

During COVID-19 survivors of domestic violence & sexual assault have often been trapped at home w/their abusers. Republican stonewalling on COVID relief & VAWA reauthorization is partisan politics at its worst. Survivors & assistance orgs need help NOW. https://t.co/CMWMdjazgM

From the frontlines of the opioid epidemic to COVID-19 – first responders endure tremendous stress & risk to protect Granite Staters. On #NationalFirstRespondersDay & every day we thank our firefighters law enforcement emergency personnel & all who answer the call to serve.

There must be more transparency about what has happened to these public servants and an end to the foot-dragging from the Trump administration. Here’s my bipartisan letter calling for a National Academy of Sciences study to be turned over to Congress: https://t.co/N2w14QITlv https://t.co/2snGyunpkF

Today at the Coos County Nursing Home in Berlin I heard about the enduring impact of #COVID19 on northern NH nursing homes. Our long-term care facilities & health care providers need more federal support NOW to protect residents & caregivers. https://t.co/Ecqr33TxJC

Glad @CMSGov is proposing to cover continuous glucose monitors under Medicare to lower costs of these lifesaving devices for Americans living w/ diabetes. This is important work that builds on efforts I fought for that successfully expanded coverage for Medicare recipients.

It's #NationalWomensSmallBusinessMonth! I’m proud of all the talented & hardworking NH women entrepreneurs who are making a difference each day creating jobs providing innovative products & services & more. Empowering our women-led small biz will always be a top priority.

Our veterans are being targeted by foreign adversaries through misinformation campaigns designed to sow confusion & mistrust in the 2020 election. We must remain vigilant against these nefarious tactics & take every step necessary to protect the integrity of our democracy. https://t.co/LkLsqUV7Nw

The threat from China is growing and it must be countered by the U.S. That's why I recently helped introduce the America LEADS Act to implement a broad new U.S.-China policy. It would strengthen our diplomatic economic military & soft power. https://t.co/yrh41D9sBU
With the rise of anti-Semitic attacks & resurgence of white supremacist groups every effort to combat anti-Semitism & all forms of hate demand attention & action at every level of government.

2 years ago today our nation bore witness to the deadliest anti-Semitic attack in U.S. history at Tree of Life Synagogue. My thoughts are w/ the families & Jewish community as they honor the 11 lives lost. https://t.co/VQFK6Qojok

The Senate could have demonstrated that once again it can put partisanship aside & help Americans in need get through this pandemic. The political jockeying has got to end – the American people are demanding results.
Further municipalities across our State are weighing whether to lay off fire fighters police school teachers & other essential services because of budget deficits caused by the virus.

All the while NH families are struggling to pay the bills small businesses have gone & hospitals are in dire financial straits as they treat a new surge in COVID-19 patients. There is still no comprehensive national plan for testing contact tracing & PPE delivery.

It's absolutely shameful that @senatemajldr has sent the Senate home without voting on a bipartisan #COVID19 relief bill. Two comprehensive bills passed by the House have been stonewalled by the Republican majority & bipartisan negotiations have been blocked for 7 months.
No one should have to live in fear that a partisan justice could annul their marriage.    Millions of gay and lesbian couples are living with that fear today. https://t.co/cK65mQwBsF
President Trump promised to appoint justices to the Supreme Court that would overturn Roe v. Wade.    Well here we are. https://t.co/ZAVRJ0sU3D
Mitch McConnell is ramming through a partisan nomination to the Supreme Court and IGNORING the needs of Americans trying to survive this pandemic. https://t.co/mGH7mQhHk3

There is too much at stake - affordable health care LGBTQ rights worker protections women’s repro health & so much more. For these reasons I will oppose Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s confirmation. https://t.co/jOTt13ThDd

Tragically every year we lose more than 6k veterans to suicide. That demands our full attention & action. I’m joining @SenatorTester to push @DeptVetAffairs to follow through on the admin’s executive order to increase veteran mental health services to help end veteran suicide.

Today is Drug Take Back Day. I urge every Granite Stater to find their nearest drop-off location and get all unused & expired medications out of their homes. By cleaning out cabinets of old prescription drugs we can protect our families & communities. https://t.co/xBxzrvK5lS https://t.co/idVX0h6tc5

Today I spoke w/ Claremont Mayor Charlene Lovett mental health providers local stakeholders & members of the NH Judicial Branch to discuss the impact the FTC will have on Sullivan County families - especially as #COVID19 exacerbates the substance use crisis. https://t.co/lasbf1CyCT

The substance use disorder epidemic has taken a tremendous toll on NH with no community in our state untouched by its devastating effects. Last week I announced $1.75M in federal support w/ the NH delegation to establish a family drug treatment court in Sullivan County.

This morning I hosted a virtual briefing w/ @AVHnh to discuss the significant impact #COVID19 has had on their facility & other providers in the region. Health care providers need relief NOW to keep their doors open & deliver vital services to NH families.
